title: How to Make Lotion from Coconut Oil

steps.title: Place 1 cup (200 grams) of coconut oil into a mixing bowl.
steps.content: Place 1 cup (200 grams) of coconut oil into a mixing bowl. Make sure that the coconut oil is solid, preferably straight from the fridge. If the coconut oil is soft, it will not whip properly.

steps.title: Add 1 teaspoon of vitamin E oil, if desired.
steps.content: Add 1 teaspoon of vitamin E oil, if desired. If you cannot find vitamin E oil in a bottle, you can use about 4 capsules of the oil instead. Pierce or open up the capsules, and empty the oil into the bowl.

steps.title: Add 10 to 15 drops of essential oil, if desired.
steps.content: Add 10 to 15 drops of essential oil, if desired. This is not absolutely necessary, but it will give the lotion a nice fragrance. You can use all one type of oil, or you can combine a few different oils and make your own, unique fragrance.

steps.title: Whip the oil on high for 6 to 7 minutes with a stick blender.
steps.content: Whip the oil on high for 6 to 7 minutes with a stick blender. From time-to-time, scrap down the sides of the bowl. Continue mixing until the oil turns light, airy, and fluffy. [3] X Research source Depending on how cold it was to begin with, it may form peaks like buttercream frosting, or it may turn smooth.

steps.title: Transfer the oil into a glass jar.
steps.content: Transfer the oil into a glass jar. Use a rubber spatula to scoop the oil into an 8-ounce (240-milliliter) glass jar. You can also divide between two 4-ounce (120-milliliter) jars instead. Store the jar at room temperature or in the fridge.

steps.title: Whip ½ cup (100 grams) of coconut oil.
steps.content: Whip ½ cup (100 grams) of coconut oil. Place ½ cup (100 grams) of solid coconut oil into a mixing bowl. Whip it on high for 6 to 9 minutes with a stick blender until it turns light and fluffy. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of aloe vera gel.
steps.content: Add 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of aloe vera gel. This will help make the lotion cool and soothing. [5] X Research source Make sure that you are using plain, 100% aloe vera gel, without too many added ingredients. Some preservatives are fine, but avoid carrageenan, fragrance oils, parabens, polysorbate 20, and retinyl palmitate. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add up to 12 drops of essential oil, if desired.
steps.content: Add up to 12 drops of essential oil, if desired. You can use all one fragrance, or you can combine a few different ones to create your own, unique scent! [7] X Research source If you want to make the lotion even more cooling, try basil, eucalyptus, lemon, lemongrass, or peppermint. [8] X Research source [9] X Research source Peppermint oil is very potent. Start with just a few drops, then add more if desired. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Stir everything together until just combined.
steps.content: Stir everything together until just combined. You can use a whisk or fork to do this, but don't overdo it, or the coconut oil will soften too much and lose its "fluff." You just want the aloe very gel to be mixed in evenly with the coconut oil, with no streaks or swirls.

steps.title: Use a rubber spatula to transfer the lotion into a glass jar.
steps.content: Use a rubber spatula to transfer the lotion into a glass jar. You can use one 8-ounce (240-milliliter) jar or two 4-ounce (120-milliliter) jars. Store the jars at room temperature. If the lotion starts to get soft, put it into the fridge.

steps.title: Microwave the coconut oil and emulsifying wax.
steps.content: Microwave the coconut oil and emulsifying wax. Place 4½ ounces (127 grams) of coconut oil and 1½ ounces (42.52 grams) emulsifying wax into a microwave-safe bowl. Heat them for 2 minutes, or until they are melted. [11] X Research source You can also set up a double-boiler and use that instead.

steps.title: Bring the water to a simmer.
steps.content: Bring the water to a simmer. Fill a small saucepan with 16 ounces (475 milliliters) of distilled water. Bring the water to a simmer, then remove it from heat. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Combine the water, oil, wax, and glycerin.
steps.content: Combine the water, oil, wax, and glycerin. Pour the simmered water into the oil/wax mixture, then add 8 ounces (240 milliliters) of glycerin. Stir everything together with a whisk or spoon until the color and texture are consistent. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Stir in some essential oil, if desired.
steps.content: Stir in some essential oil, if desired. Plan on using 10 to 15 drops of essential oil. You can use all one fragrance, or a combination of different ones for something more unique. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the lotion into glass jars.
steps.content: Pour the lotion into glass jars. Divide the lotion between several 4-ounce (120-milliliter) mason jars, then pour the rest into a larger jar for storage. Store the little jars in your bathroom and the big jar in the fridge. [15] X Research source If it is very warm where you live, store all of the jars in the fridge.
